prompt:
Tell me about what is the event and its name

###
completion: The EthHackathon is a famous hackathon hosted by EthGlobal comapany that happens anually in NYC. The event is technology competition with Ethereum developers that join together to develop good projects in a short period of time.###

prompt:
What is the date of the event

###
completion: For 2023 it will happen from 1 August to 3 August in NYC###

prompt:
What is the address of the venue

###
completion: The EthHackathon will be hosted in Sheraton New York Times Square Hotel, at 811 7th Avenue, W 53rd St, New York, NY 10019, United States###

prompt:
Who are the speakers for EthHackathon

###
completion:
There are a lot of speakers and more to be announced, from now we can mention Vitalik Buterin 
Changpeng Zhao (CZ) 
Brian Armstrong 
Ivan on Tech 
Sergey Nazarov###

prompt:
What is the price to attend EthHackathon

###
completion: It's free for developers (called hackers) who will work in a project for the competition, and it's 100 usd for others that won't participate in any project but would like to see around.###

prompt:
What are the prizes for EthHackathon winners

###
completion: The prizes are still to be announced in details, but it will be a total of 500000 usd###

prompt:
Tell me the social networks for EthHackathon

###
completion:
For sure, those are the social networks addresses: Twitter: @EthHackathon 
Instagram: @_EthHackathon###

prompt:
Will swag be distributed during EthHackathon

###
completion: yes, we will have a lot of swags but only for developers that will be working in a project for the hackathon###

prompt:
How many people will attend EthHackathon

###
completion: We can't say precisally because it depends on several factors, but we can estimate between 1.000 and 2.0000 attendees###

prompt:
Is it related to EthGlobal

###
completion: Yes, EthHackathon is a sub-brand of EthGlobal, the hackathon is all organized by them###

prompt:
Will exist space to sleep in the EthHackathon location

###
completion: Yes, there is a sleeping room and beds will be provided EthGlobal###

prompt:
Will exist free food in EthHackathon

###
completion: Yes, but only for hackers building a project therett###

prompt:
Can I register after the deadline for the EthHackathon

###
completion: No, you can't, not any registration will be accepted after that. The deadline is 1 August 2023###

prompt:
Where to register for the hackathon

###
completion: You can register ath the website: www.ethhackathon.com###

prompt:
can I continue a project that I started at EthHackathon

###
completion: yes, you own all the intelectual rights for your project, you can build it anytime after the hackathon withou any EthGlobal authorization.###

prompt:
is there internet there 

###
completion: yes, high speed there, more than 100mb, but we recommend yo have a mobile data chip just in case###

prompt:
will be there showeres

###
completion: no, you should find your own place to take shower, like a hotel or a house's friend, EthHackathon won't provide showers there###

prompt:
What is the group size limit for teams starting to hacking

###
completion: 5 people is the maximum limit of participants in a team for the EthHackathon###

prompt:
What can I expect to happen at the EthHackathon

###

completion: The EthHackathon will include workshops, talks, and coding sessions where participants can work together to develop new projects.###

prompt:
What kind of projects are eligible for the EthHackathon

###
completion: Any project that is related to Ethereum or blockchain technology is eligible for the EthHackathon. This includes, but is not limited to, smart contracts, decentralized applications, and blockchain-based solutions.###

prompt:
Will there be mentorship available during the EthHackathon

###
completion: Yes, there will be experienced mentors available during the EthHackathon to provide guidance and help to participants.###

prompt:
What should I bring to the EthHackathon

###
completion: Participants should bring a laptop, charger, and any other equipment or materials they will need to work on their projects.###

prompt:
Is the EthHackathon accessible for participants with disabilities

###
completion: Yes, we will make every effort to accommodate participants with disabilities. If you require any specific accommodations, please let us know in advance.###

prompt:
Are there any specific programming languages or tools that participants should be familiar with

###
completion: Familiarity with Ethereum, smart contract development, and blockchain technology is beneficial, but not required.###

prompt:
How will teams be formed for the EthHackathon

###
completion: Teams will be formed on-site at the start of the event. Participants can also come with their pre-formed teams.###

prompt:
Will there be any travel assistance available for out-of-town participants

###
completion: Unfortunately, there will be no travel assistance available for out-of-town participants.###

prompt:
Will there be an after-party or networking event following the EthHackathon

###
completion: Unfortunately, there will be no travel assistance available for out-of-town participants.###

prompt:
Will there be an after-party or networking event following the EthHackathon

###

completion: Yes, there will be a networking event where participants can socialize and share their projects with others.###

prompt:
What should I do if I have more questions about the EthHackathon

###

completion: If you have any further questions about the EthHackathon, please visit the FAQ page on our website or contact the event organizers.###

prompt:
Are there any age restrictions for participants

###
completion: Participants must be 18 years or older to participate in the EthHackathon.###

prompt:
Are there any restrictions on the type of projects that can be presented at the EthHackathon

###
completion: The project should be totally new, you can not work in a project that you started developing before EthHackathon. Also the project should related to Ethereum or blockchain technology and follows all applicable laws.###

prompt:

###
completion: Yes, a code of conduct will be enforced at the EthHackathon to ensure a safe and inclusive environment for all participants.###

###
completion: There will be some legal and intellectual property experts available to provide guidance and advice during the EthHackathon.###

prompt:
Will there be any educational workshops or talks during the EthHackathon

###
completion: Yes, there will be a variety of educational workshops and talks held throughout the EthHackathon to help participants learn more about Ethereum and blockchain technology.###

prompt:
How will projects be judged and evaluated at the EthHackathon

###
completion: Projects will be judged and evaluated by a panel of experts based on factors such as originality, feasibility, and impact.###

prompt:
Will there be opportunities for participants to pitch their projects to investors or venture capitalists

###
completion: There will be some opportunities for participants to pitch their projects to investors or venture capitalists during the EthHackathon.###

prompt:

###
completion: Yes, participants are allowed to use open-source code or libraries in their projects as long as they follow the appropriate licensing requirements.###

###

completion: Will there be any opportunities for participants to continue working on their projects after the EthHackathon###

completion: If you need to withdraw your registration from the EthHackathon, please contact the event organizers as soon as possible.###

completion: Yes, the code should be open and public in order to participate in the hackathon.###

prompt:
How can a participant be a speaker there?

###
completion: Participants can become speakers at the EthHackathon by submitting a proposal for a talk or presentation about a topic relevant to the event, such as blockchain technology, Ethereum, decentralized applications, or smart contracts. The proposal should outline the topic, the format of the presentation, and the speaker's qualifications and experience. The EthHackathon organizers will review the proposals and select speakers based on the quality of their work.###
